problems.title: Problem 1
problems.content: The resistance, inductance, and capacitance in a parallel RLC circuit in (Figure 1) are <input id='p1-R' type='number'/> kΩ, <input id='p1-L' type='number'/> H, and <input id='p1-C' type='number'/> μF, respectively.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Calculate the minimum root of the characteristic equation that describes the voltage response of the circuit.
parts.need: Express your answer in radians per second to three significant figures.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Calculate the maximum root of the characteristic equation that describes the voltage response of the circuit.
parts.need: Express your answer in radians per second to three significant figures.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Will the response be over-, under-, or critically damped?

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: What value of R will yield a damped frequency of <input id='p1-d-X' type='number'/> rad/s?
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part E
parts.content: What are the roots of the characteristic equation for the value of R found in Part D?
parts.need: Express your answers in radians per second to three significant figures separated by a comma. Enter your answers in rectangular form.

parts.title: Part F
parts.content: What value of R will result in a critically damped response?
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 2
problems.content: The voltage response for the circuit in (Figure 1) is known to be v (t) = D<sub>1</sub>te<sup>-500t</sup> + D<sub>2</sub>e<sup>-500t</sup>, t≥0, where t is in seconds. The initial current in the inductor (I<sub>0</sub>) is -10 mA, and the initial voltage on the capacitor (V<sub>0</sub>) is 8 V. The inductance is 4 H.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find the value of R.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find the value of C.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Find the value of D<sub>1</sub>.
parts.need: Express your answer in volts per second to three significant figures.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Find the value of D<sub>2</sub>.
parts.need: Express your answer in volts to three significant figures.

parts.title: Part E
parts.content: Choose the correct expression for i<sub>C</sub> (t) for t≥0+.

problems.title: Problem 3
problems.content: The two switches in the circuit seen in (Figure 1) operate synchronously. When switch 1 is in position a, switch 2 is in position d. When switch 1 moves to position b, switch 2 moves to position c. Switch 1 has been in position a for a long time. At t = 0, the switches move to their alternate positions.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Choose the correct expression for v<sub>o</sub> (t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 4
problems.content: The switch in the circuit of (Figure 1) has been in position a for a long time. At t = 0 the switch moves instantaneously to position b.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find v<sub>o</sub> (t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 5
problems.content: Suppose the inductor in the circuit shown in (Figure 1) with a resonant radian frequency of 5000 rad/s has a value of 10 mH.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Suppose that R = <input id='p5-a-R' type='number'/> Ω. Determine the damping type of the circuit.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Calculate the roots of the characteristic equation for
parts.need: Express your answers in radians per second to three significant figures separated by a comma. Enter your answers in rectangular form.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Suppose that R = <input id='p5-c-R' type='number'/> Ω. Determine the damping type of the circuit.
parts.need: Express your answers in radians per second to three significant figures separated by a comma. Enter your answers in rectangular form.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Calculate the roots of the characteristic equation for
parts.need: Express your answers in radians per second to three significant figures separated by a comma. Enter your answers in rectangular form.

problems.title: Problem 6
problems.content: The switch in the circuit in (Figure 1) has been open for a long time before closing at t = 0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find v<sub>o</sub> for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 7
problems.content: The switch in the circuit in (Figure 1) has been open a long time before closing at t = 0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find i<sub>L</sub> (t) for t≥0.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find v<sub>C</sub> (t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 8
problems.content: Switches 1 and 2 in the circuit in (Figure 1) are synchronized. When switch 1 is opened, switch 2 closes and vice versa. Switch 1 has been open a long time before closing at t = 0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Choose the correct expression for i<sub>L</sub> (t) for t≥0.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find v<sub>C</sub> (t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 9
problems.content: The current in the circuit in the followin figure is known to be i = B<sub>1</sub>e<sup>-2000t</sup>cos1500t + B<sub>2</sub>e<sup>-2000t</sup>sin1500t, t≥0. The capacitor has a value of 80 nF; the initial value of the current is <input id='p9-I' type='number'/> mA; and the initial voltage on the capacitor is <input id='p9-V' type='number'/> V.(Figure 1)

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find the value of R.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find the value of L.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Find the value of B<sub>1</sub>.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Find the value of B<sub>2</sub>.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 10
problems.content: The circuit shown in (Figure 1) has been in operation for a long time. At t=0 the two switches move to the new positions shown in the figure.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find i<sub>o</sub> (t) for t≥0.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find v<sub>o</sub> (t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 11
problems.content: The switch in the circuit in (Figure 1) has been in position a for a long time. At t = 0, the switch moves instantaneously to position b.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: What is the initial value of v<sub>a</sub>?
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: What is the initial value of dv<sub>a</sub>/dt?
parts.need: Express your answer in volts per second to three significant figures.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: What is the numerical expression for v<sub>a</sub> (t) for t≥0?

problems.title: Problem 12
problems.content: The resistor in the circuit shown in (Figure 1) is changed to 250 Ω. The initial energy stored is zero.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find v<sub>o</sub> (t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 13
problems.content: The resistor in the circuit shown in (Figure 1) is changed to 312.5 Ω. The initial energy stored is zero.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Choose the correct expression of v<sub>o</sub> (t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 14
problems.content: The two switches in the circuit seen in (Figure 1) operate synchronously. When switch 1 is in position a, switch 2 is closed. When switch 1 is in position b, switch 2 is open. Switch 1 has been in position a for a long time. At t=0, it moves instantaneously to position b.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find v<sub>c</sub> (t) for t≥0.
